version_description:
We improved how points are displayed on stations for Bike Angels (Don’t know what Bike Angels is? Well, you should check it out at bikeangels.citibikenyc.com).

Want to vent, gripe, or gush? We love hearing from you. Shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

We're introducing an improved Help Center – putting the answers to all your questions right at your fingertips.

What else:
- Station detail now magically drops away when you start your ride, leaving you with a bigger map to find your way
- An unfriendly "Invalid Syntax" message was sometimes displayed on the forgot password page (kind of an "invalid syntax" of its own... a very meta bug) - no longer.

Enjoy!

Want to vent, gripe, or gush? We love hearing from you. Shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

We’re excited to bring you the fastest way to start riding. Introducing Apple Pay for Citi Bike! Choose your pass, click the Apple Pay button, and you’ll be on a bike in no time.

Of course we think this is pretty cool, but it’s what you think that matters. If you sign up using Apple Pay, we’d love to hear about your experience. Please give us a shout on Twitter @citibikenyc or email at app@citibikenyc.com with any feedback, good or bad. Thanks!

In this release we have fewer errors and some cleaner designs.

Improvements:
- Added two lines for station names in the Riding Stats to allow for longer station names.
- Some polishing touches to the end-of-ride screen
And some bug fixes:
- A blinking ride timer that no longer blinks
- An error incorrectly displayed after renewing your membership

Want to vent, gripe, or gush? We love hearing from you. Shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

We did our best Gallagher impression this week and brought out the best home tool to squash some bugs: The Sledge-O-Matic. It handled 4 bugs, a pesky 3rd party library, and multiple watermelons with ease! Now our app is less likely to crash and runs lighter - 10/10 would recommend.

Want to vent, gripe, or gush? We love hearing from you. Shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

We’re excited to bring you a brand new map! We’ve rebuilt the core architecture of the app to bring you an ultra responsive, super fast map.

For all our Bike Angels out there, you should notice this performance enhancement as you scroll and zoom with the BA layer on.

We’d love to hear your feedback on this one. Find us on twitter @citibikenyc or shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Are favorites your favorite? Well we just improved them so they’re saved in the cloud and not just your phone. Now when you buy that hot new phone, your favorites will come with you. We also made a small change to the login screen to use the email default screen so the “@” symbol is easily accessible.

Want to vent, gripe, or gush? We love hearing from you. Shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

This year, here at Citi Bike, we are thankful for you, our riders. To show it, we wrote you a poem for the features in this update:

We gave you a new map a few releases ago,
yet once in awhile, station-loading was slow.
So we coded and fixed; improved, you know?
Now stations are snappy so you’re good to go.
And how about that stats drawer? It was good, although
We wanted it crisper and cleaner, just for show.

Happy Turkey Day!

Cheers,
The Citi Bike App Team

Want to vent, gripe, or gush? We love hearing from you. Shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

We hope everyone had a great Thanksgiving! What better way to pedal off that pie than riding a few extra miles on a Citi Bike?! Here's what we have for you in this release:

- You've broken up with your ex, unfriended them on Facebook, and now you need to delete their station from your faves in the Citi Bike app? Don't worry, we got you. Now you can delete Favorite stations right
from the Favorites list.
- Improvements to the sign-up flow to look better on the iPhone X.
- Optimizations to reduce battery consumption while app is in background.

Want to vent, gripe, or gush? We love hearing from you. Shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Hey there, Citi Bike family. This is our last release of the year so we'd like to take a moment to celebrate 2017. Over the past year, we've come a long way, and none of it would have been possible without you. You've taken over 16 million rides and had over 15 million app sessions. This year we revamped the look and feel of the app, launched apps in 5 new cities, and rebuilt our map from scratch. For our final 2017 release, we're making it easier for you to find the closest station to any place around town. Now you can use your app to search for your favorite coffee shop, restaurant, or Karaoke spot and it'll show you the closest stations to that location.

We have an amazing 2018 planned for you. Plan a Ride will be back soon and be better than ever, along with a ton of other features you're going to love.

Want to gush, gripe or wish us a Happy New Year? We love hearing from you. Shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Happy New Year! This version comes out of the hard work our team did in the final weeks of 2017. . . you know, those weeks when you're buying some last minute presents, dealing with in-laws, and kinda phoning it in to work, if you're going at all. So set your expectations low, alright? Kidding. We took that time to catch up on some code that's been bugging us for a while-- no pun intended. This update is our belated holiday gift to you. The improvements are subtle, but the app is better, trust us. Here's to an awesome 2018!

Want to gush, gripe or wish us a Happy New Year? We love hearing from you. Shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

We have an exciting update for you today, riders! Just like you, we're passionate about urban cycling and improving bike infrastructure in the city that never sleeps. That's why we're partnering with NYC DOT to help the cause while improving app functionality for you. You can now opt-in to a new feature called Ride Insights, which will use your phone's location during a ride to record the route you take. These routes are then anonymized and shared with the DOT to help them understand the growing needs of our biking community. Additionally, we'll use this route to calculate a more accurate riding distance for you.

Launching this feature is the first step in bringing better data to our cities and our users. We're rolling out the feature to Bike Angels first, so if you want to test it out but aren't a Bike Angel yet, head over to citibikenyc.com/bikeangels to register. As always, we welcome your feedback, especially on a feature of this size. Please drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com. Thanks!

Hey Citi Bikers, we have an update for you.
Mostly "under-the-hood" improvements we needed to do.

We added, deleted, and polished the code,
to our wonderful programmers the "thank you" is owed.

Most of these changes are just out of sight,
because planning for the future means getting the foundation right.

Please give us a shout with your comments and questions,
we relish and love your insightful suggestions.

app@citibikenyc.com is where your thoughts should be penned
And of course, as always, thanks for being a friend.

Many of you have asked for an easier way to update your payment info. We heard you. And hey let's be honest, we want your payment info to be up-to-date too. Now you can easily update your credit card right from the menu.

Want to gush, gripe or vent? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com

We have an exciting update for you today, riders! Just like you, we're passionate about urban cycling and improving bike infrastructure in the city that never sleeps. That's why we're partnering with NYC DOT to help the cause while improving app functionality for you. You can now opt-in to a new feature called Ride Insights, which will use your phone's location during a ride to record the route you take. These routes are then anonymized and shared with the DOT to help them understand the growing needs of our biking community. Additionally, we'll use this route to calculate a more accurate riding distance for you.

Launching this feature is the first step in bringing better data to our cities and our users. We're rolling out the feature to Bike Angels first, so if you want to test it out but aren't a Bike Angel yet, head over to citibikenyc.com/bikeangels to register. As always, we welcome your feedback, especially on a feature of this size. Please drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com. Thanks!

After a successful run with the new Ride Insights feature with our Bike Angels (thanks for the feedback!), we're rolling out this feature to everyone.

From the last release about Ride Insights:

We have an exciting update for you today, riders! Just like you, we're passionate about urban cycling and improving bike infrastructure in the city that never sleeps. That's why we're partnering with NYC DOT to help the cause while improving app functionality for you. You can now opt-in to a new feature called Ride Insights, which will use your phone's location during a ride to record the route you take. These routes are then anonymized and shared with the DOT to help them understand the growing needs of our biking community. Additionally, we'll use this route to calculate a more accurate riding distance for you.

Launching this feature is the first step in bringing better data to our cities and our users. As always, we welcome your feedback, especially on a feature of this size. Thanks!

app@citibikenyc.com

You asked, we heard, and today we are happily delivering. Drum roll please...in this version you can plan a ride in the Citi Bike app! You can use the search icon in the upper right corner to find your destination, or go from the station details of your beginning station. The app will create a bike-friendly route from the stations closest to your start and end locations. We're still evaluating the suggested routes and want your feedback. If you think there's a better route than the one suggested, please screenshot it, send it to app@citibikenyc.com, and tell us how the route could be improved.

Thank you all for your continued feedback and feature requests. Happy routing!

¡Hola! Nuestra app ahora está disponible en español. Si el lenguaje de su aparato esta en español, la app se traducirá automáticamente para usted. (Curious English speakers, feel free to pop those sentences into Google translate.) And now it’s even easier to Plan a Ride. 1. Bike lanes and Bike Angel points show up in preview mode (score) and 2. You can click from the directions list to zoom to that specific direction on the map (woah). Happy riding! Want to vent, gripe or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

We've got some good ones for you in this round--
Happy to announce a frequently requested feature-- Apple Health app integration! You can now get your workout credit in the Health app when you pedal. Turn it on from settings, then make sure to open the app after each ride to send that ride to the Health app.
An update to Plan a Ride to give you a ride-in-progress view. Even if you don't need routing, check it out because it'll show you how many docks are at the station you're headed to.
Lastly, an update to your timer so that it's only displayed after the app confirms you still have a bike out. Now you won't get that post-dock split-second anxiety when you open your app to see the timer still running. Phew!

Can you guys feel that? That shift beneath your palms as you open up the next step towards our new app? It’s incredible, isn’t it? A new menu. Cue the Ooos and Ahhs. It might not seems like much but if you throw a pebble in water, you’ll see the ripples . . . We’re mixing metaphors, but what we’re trying to say is that big things are coming. To our Bike Angels, a little badge now rests on the shoulders of your profile image. Happy riding! Want to vent, gripe or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

We added something fun to the menu. It’s a double cheeseburger with a side of fries. Sorry, it’s lunchtime and we’re hungry. But for real, now you can see your last ride in your menu. We know, we know, it’s in two places but we’re paving the way to declutter your main map screen. Consider this Step 1. Now about that double cheese... Happy riding!

Want to vent, grip or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Extra, extra, read all about it! We’re going all in on the mobile-first movement, which means some basic (but big) profile updates are here for your fingertips. You can now see and update your profile info from the app. Mind. Blown. We know, we know, not totally epic, but every step we take, every move we make, is making its way towards a one-of-a-kind mobile experience. Happy riding! Want to vent, gripe or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Hey hey we have a fun one for you today! We know that you have a personal connection to Citi Bike, and we wanted to honor that with something fun and, well, personal. So now you can add a profile pic! It can be your best headshot, your favorite dog, or that time you took a selfie while biking with a perfect sunset behind you (we don't condone selfies while biking). Is it going to help you get from point A to point B? Maybe not. Will it make it a little more fun? We think so. Happy riding!

Want to vent, grip or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

(Please read in Price is Right voice:) IT’S A BRAND NEW MAAAAP! With an expanded map area, buttons on the bottom right, and your favorite stations within thumb’s reach, this bigger, better map is going to be perfect for bigger, better bike rides. It even comes with...ride history! So now you can go back and marvel at your stats from your first ride to your last.

Happy riding! Want to vent, gripe or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Just a quick update to fix a bug with deep linking into the app from external sources, such as emails and our website.

From the last release:
(Please read in Price is Right voice:) IT’S A BRAND NEW MAAAAP! With an expanded map area, buttons on the bottom right, and your favorite stations within thumb’s reach, this bigger, better map is going to be perfect for bigger, better bike rides. It even comes with...ride history! So now you can go back and marvel at your stats from your first ride to your last.
Happy riding! Want to vent, gripe or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Time for Bike Angels to feel #blessed. Now your monthly, yearly, and lifetime points live right in your menu so you can keep track of how much good you’re doing (not that this is a competition...or there’re prizes involved). Happy riding!

Want to vent, gripe or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Remember when only one time-bubble would show up for a planned route? Those were the days. Good news is, those days are back. Cause we fixed it (along with some other bugs). Time to start pedaling towards new memories. Or just to and from work. Whatever’s best for you.

Want to vent, gripe or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

We've been working on some exciting things that are coming your way. We have a fresh new ride code screen for your viewing pleasure, making it easier to grab those 5 digits to unlock your trusty steed. We also added the terms and conditions to the menu...also for your viewing pleasure?? IDK our lawyers thought it was a pretty cool feature, all right? Keep your app up-to-date and stay tuned!
Want to vent, gripe or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

We've been working on some exciting things that are coming your way. We have a fresh new ride code screen for your viewing pleasure, making it easier to grab those 5 digits to unlock your trusty steed. We also added the terms and conditions to the menu...also for your viewing pleasure?? IDK our lawyers thought it was a pretty cool feature, all right? Keep your app up-to-date and stay tuned!

Want to vent, gripe or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

This week’s update is electric. If you haven’t heard, pedal-assist ebikes joined the Citi Bike fleet. These buzzworthy bikes have a motor to turbo charge your ride so you can explore NYC without breaking a sweat. To find the closest bike to you, look for the lightning bolt icon in the app, ride as you normally would, and enjoy feeling like a superhero. No capes required. (Unless you’re already wearing one...which is totally cool too.)

Want to vent, gripe or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Life is a highway, but we have a feeling you’d rather ride in the bike lane. That’s why we updated the map to feature bike lanes, deprioritized highways, and made the pins even smaller so the better routes are easier to see. Ride on, ladies and gents. Ride on.

Want to vent, gripe or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Life is a highway, but we have a feeling you’d rather ride in the bike lane. That’s why we updated the map to feature bike lanes, deprioritized highways, and made the pins even smaller so the better routes are easier to see. Ride on, ladies and gents. Ride on.

Want to vent, gripe or gush? We love hearing from you. Drop us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

We’re gearing up for our Women’s Bike Month celebration and part of the party prep is making discount codes easier to use in the app. Which should be a pretty big hint of what we’re putting in the goody bag. (It’s discounted rides.) Don’t forget to RSVP.
As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com

A small bug fix on top of the last release.

From the last release: We’re gearing up for our Women’s Bike Month celebration and part of the party prep is making discount codes easier to use in the app. Which should be a pretty big hint of what we’re putting in the goody bag. (It’s discounted rides.) Don’t forget to RSVP. As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

You know when you’re out with your friends who don’t have a membership and they’re like, “Ugh, the next place is too far to walk and too short to drive!” And you’re like, “Wish we could all just take a quick bike ride!” And they’re like, “Us too!” And then you stand there for a while in wistful silence? Good news! Group Ride is here! Now you can take up to 4 friends on any trip for the same low price as a single ride. Just buy them rides and unlock their bikes straight from your app.

As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Just a quick bug fix. From the last release:

As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

You know what they say about making assumptions. . . Well, to-date, our beloved app has been making some assumptions about how you think about distance, but perhaps you live in the US and think in kilometers. Or maybe your phone is set on Canadian English but you think in miles. Well now the choice is up to you. Go to settings to choose miles or kilometers. In the next release: Furlongs.

As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Parents aren’t supposed to have favorites. But we all know they do. Just like we all have our favorite of our favorite stations. Like we love all our stations equally, but there is one station we for sure love more than the others because it just cares about us more, ya know? And then sometimes we move. Or get a new job. Or fall in love with someone that doesn’t live in the same neighborhood as us. And then our favorite stations change. As do our hearts. That’s why we updated your favorites list, so you can sort, arrange, and order your “favorite” stations to your heart’s content. So, go ahead, shout your love for that station from the top of the screen, or the top of your roof if you have access.

As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

We’re a bit biased here, but we think bike share is a really dynamic way to get around. Dynamic in the “lots of change” sense; the number of bikes at each station changes constantly and your app shares up-to-the second information. But we’ve heard from Bike Angels that changing points while mid-rental is confusing, and, well, we agree. So now Bike Angels points won’t change while you’re in the middle of a trip. Score those rewards with extra peace of mind.

As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

It’s that time of year again -- the lights are shining, a mug of hot cocoa warms your hands, and you’re trying not to stress about gifts because you KNOW that’s not in the holiday spirit and what’s the point of all this fuss anyway and aren’t holidays supposed to be relaxing?!

Anyway, we’re here to help! Check out your menu for a link to our awesome holiday store where you can bring all your friends and family into the world of bikeshare with you. We fixed some bugs too. Stay warm!

As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Bike Angels, it’s time to fly a little smoother. First of all, for all you who’ve been pondering signing up, now we made it even easier. Just sign up directly from the menu in your app. Secondly, we added some fun things to your ride history. Now you can see your Bike Angel points per ride, station values at the time of your ride, and any overage fees you may have gotten. Ahh, that feels gooooood doesn’t it?

As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Just sign up directly from the menu in your app. Secondly, we added some fun things to your ride history. Now you can see your Bike Angel points per ride, station values at the time of your ride, and any overage fees you may have gotten. Ahh, that feels gooooood doesn’t it?

As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

If your password contains an uppercase letter, lowercase letter, special character, haikus, and the hieroglyphics, this update is for you. Now you can change your password (however complicated it is) anytime straight from the app. Just tap on "Edit Profile" from the menu and you can set a new password from there. If your password is currently “password,” this update is for you! Go use it! Like now.

As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

You enter your password. Error. You try another one. Error. What about the password you use for almost everything else? Nah. OMFGHSKDFJSD. *Throws phone out the window.* Good news folks, we just made resetting passwords much, much easier. Now, the password reset link in the email takes you right to the app so you can reset your password with ease. And remember, make it unique with at least 30 characters, numbers, uppercase, lowercase, emojis, and hieroglyphics.

As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

You know the pros when you see ‘em. In one swift motion, the phone emerges, the bike releases from the dock and before you can even blink, they’re riding off into the sunset. It’s beautiful. But not everyone is a pro. We wanted to help the newbies unlock a bike a little faster, so we built a slick animation on the Ride Code screen highlighting exactly where to enter your code so you can unlock and get going. One small step for man, a giant leap for all of bikerkind.

As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.

Thanks for using Citi Bike! We update our app regularly to make your rides even better. Every update of our Citi Bike app includes improvements in speed and reliability. As new features are released, we’ll highlight those for you in the app.

Here is what you will find in our latest update:
- We fixed an issue affecting iOS 10 users.

As always, we’d love to hear from you, please shoot us a line at app@citibikenyc.com.
